properties.description: Improving public understanding and interdisciplinary teaching of evolutionary science, particularly human behavior and cooperation.
Exploring human behavior as a conceptual lens for sustainability education and the development of community science approaches.
Applying insights from cultural evolution science to school improvement, educational innovation, and community development.
Exploring evidence-based, democratic approaches to neighborhood noise policy as part of broader social behavior and public health concerns.
Design and implementation of community-based science initiatives to support local education, resource management, and sustainability.
Developing inclusive, values-driven frameworks for improving educational systems through interdisciplinary collaboration and research.
